intro: Hemizonia increscens subsp. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy hemizonia, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a distinctive, fragrant aroma. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger, more robust leaves compared to other members of the species.
